articles.title: Plea In Supreme Court Challenges UGC Regulation Defining 'Caste Discrimination', Seeks Caste Neutral Provision
articles.summary: A plea has been filed before the Supreme Court challenging Regulation 3(c) of the newly enacted University Grants Commission (Promotion of Equity in Higher Education Institutions) Regulations, 2026 on the ground that the protection accorded by it against caste-discrimination is non-inclusionary. As per Regulation 3(c) of the UGC Regulations, "caste-based discrimination" means "discrimination only on the basis of caste or tribe against the members of the scheduled castes, scheduled tribes, and ot

articles.title: Section 69A Addition Quashed Where Property Payment Was Deferred
articles.summary: Whether outstanding purchase consideration can be treated as unexplained money. Addition quashed. Takeaway: Deferred payments later settled via banks with TDS cannot be taxed on suspicion. The post Section 69A Addition Quashed Where Property Payment Was Deferred appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Notice Under Section 148 Set Aside for Lack of Jurisdiction
articles.summary: The Tribunal quashed reassessment proceedings after finding that the Assessing Officer already possessed complete information before issuing notice under section 148. The post Notice Under Section 148 Set Aside for Lack of Jurisdiction appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 263 Order Set Aside Where Underlying Section 153C Assessment Itself Is Time-Barred
articles.summary: Holding the assessment void ab initio due to limitation, the Tribunal quashed the revision orders. The ruling underscores that revision cannot cure a fundamentally invalid assessment. The post Section 263 Order Set Aside Where Underlying Section 153C Assessment Itself Is Time-Barred appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Reassessment Quashed for Sanction by Incompetent Authority
articles.summary: The Tribunal held that reassessment initiated with approval from an incorrect authority violates section 151. Such jurisdictional defect renders the section 148 notice void. The post Reassessment Quashed for Sanction by Incompetent Authority appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 153A Assessment Quashed for Mechanical u/s 153D Approval
articles.summary: It was ruled that granting a single, common approval for multiple assessment years violates the mandate of Section 153D. Each assessment year requires separate and conscious examination by the approving authority. The post Section 153A Assessment Quashed for Mechanical u/s 153D Approval appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: No Double Penalty for Same Default Under Sections 271A and 271B
articles.summary: The tribunal held that once penalty is imposed for non-maintenance of books, a second penalty for non-audit cannot be levied. Levy of section 271B was held to be impermissible double penalisation. The post No Double Penalty for Same Default Under Sections 271A and 271B appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Final Assessment Quashed for Breach of Statutory Time Limits
articles.summary: The Tribunal ruled that Sections 144C and 153 must be read harmoniously and that DRP proceedings do not extend statutory limitation. Any final order issued beyond the prescribed time is void ab initio and liable to be quashed. The post Final Assessment Quashed for Breach of Statutory Time Limits appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Reassessment Quashed for Being Initiated by Wrong Authority Under Faceless Scheme
articles.summary: The Tribunal held that reassessment notices issued by the Jurisdictional AO after the faceless regime came into force are invalid. The key takeaway is that only faceless authorities can initiate reassessment post-29 March 2022. The post Reassessment Quashed for Being Initiated by Wrong Authority Under Faceless Scheme appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Corporate Tax Incentives for ESG Compliance in India: Aligning Fiscal Policy with Sustainability Goals
articles.summary: The article analyses gaps in India’s current tax incentives for ESG compliance. It concludes that existing measures are inconsistent, inefficient, and insufficient to drive meaningful sustainability outcomes. The post Corporate Tax Incentives for ESG Compliance in India: Aligning Fiscal Policy with Sustainability Goals appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 153D Approval Valid as Administrative, Not Quasi-Judicial
articles.summary: The Tribunal clarified that approval under section 153D is an administrative safeguard and need not contain elaborate reasoning. Allegations of mechanical approval fail without concrete evidence of non-application of mind. The post Section 153D Approval Valid as Administrative, Not Quasi-Judicial appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 153C Proceedings Quashed for Lack of Incriminating Material
articles.summary: The tribunal held that assessment under section 153C cannot be initiated without seized material belonging to or relating to the assessee. Third-party statements and assumptions, without incriminating evidence, were held insufficient to confer jurisdiction The post Section 153C Proceedings Quashed for Lack of Incriminating Material appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Reassessment Quashed as Section 148 Notice Issued by Wrong Authority
articles.summary: The Tribunal held that reassessment proceedings are invalid where notices are issued by the Jurisdictional AO instead of the Faceless AO. Non-compliance with the faceless scheme renders the entire process void. The post Reassessment Quashed as Section 148 Notice Issued by Wrong Authority appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 36(1)(iii) Disallowance Quashed Due to Prior Adjustment
articles.summary: The decision reiterates that the Revenue must prove that borrowed funds were actually used for non-business purposes. In absence of such proof, interest paid to banks remains allowable. The post Section 36(1)(iii) Disallowance Quashed Due to Prior Adjustment appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.summary: The Patna High Court held that a victim cannot maintain a criminal appeal solely on the ground that the sentence awarded is inadequate. It clarified that the victim's right of appeal under Section 372 CrPC is limited to only three contingencies: (i) acquittal of the accused, (ii) conviction for a lesser offence, or (iii) imposition of inadequate compensation. articles.summary: Apple’s expanding iPhone manufacturing footprint is reshaping India’s electronics supply chain, with over half of the ₹54,567 crore approved under the ECMS scheme tied to iPhone component demand.

articles.title: Experience as digital foundation: The invisible architecture of human-centered transformation
articles.summary: Most digital transformations fail not because technology falls short, but because the design fails to reflect human behavior and the realities of daily work, notes Jagadeshwar Gattu, President – Digital Foundation Services at HCLTech.

articles.title: Screen Reader iconScreen Reader
Pinterest cuts nearly 15% jobs to redirect resources to AI
articles.summary: Pinterest said on Tuesday it would reduce its workforce ‌by less ‌than 15% and shrink ‌office space, as the social media company reallocates resources to artificial intelligence initiatives.

articles.title: EU to make WhatsApp more responsible for tackling harmful content
articles.summary: The channels had 51.7 million average monthly active users in the EU in the first six months of ​2025, more than the 45-million-user threshold ​set out in the DSA. The DSA requires such ‌large platforms ‍to do more to tackle illegal and ‍harmful content, which can become costly for ‌the platforms given the volume of data to be scanned, and raises questions of privacy.

articles.title: Meta, TikTok, YouTube to stand trial on youth addiction claims
articles.summary: Tech giants Meta, TikTok, and YouTube are in court this week. A lawsuit alleges their platforms caused a 19-year-old woman depression and suicidal thoughts. This trial is the first of its kind. The jury will decide if the companies were negligent. Meanwhile, these companies are promoting tools for parents to control kids' screen time.

articles.title: Apple to unveil Gemini-powered Siri update in February: Report
articles.summary: The update, which is central to the company's partnership with Google, will leverage the latter's Gemini AI models as Apple looks to evolve Siri beyond being a traditional voice-based assistant.

articles.title: Social media giants Alphabet, ByteDance and Meta face landmark trial over addiction claims
articles.summary: Defendants in the suit are Alphabet, ByteDance and Meta, the tech titans behind YouTube, TikTok and Instagram. Meta cofounder and chief executive Mark Zuckerberg is slated to be called as a witness during the trial.

articles.title: Samsung to start production of HBM4 chips next month for Nvidia supply: Report
articles.summary: Samsung Electronics plans ‍to start production of ​its next-generation high-bandwidth memory (HBM) chips, or HBM4, next month ⁠and supply them to Nvidia. Samsung has been trying to catch up with cross-town rival SK Hynix, ‌a primary ‌supplier for advanced memory chips crucial for Nvidia's AI accelerators, after supply delays ‌had hit its earnings and share prices earlier last year.

articles.title: Competitive intensity increases as Amazon, Flipkart take on quick commerce players
articles.summary: Competition in the quick commerce sector is getting even more intense as Amazon and Flipkart step up discounting to challenge Blinkit, Zepto and Swiggy Instamart, triggering a fresh price war. Discounts rose to 55% in January, with Amazon Now matching Zepto, while Flipkart XtraSaver boosts bulk promotions.

articles.title: D2C brands see Republic Day sales momentum continuing on ecommerce
articles.summary: Direct-to-consumer brands in categories like jewellery, apparel, footwear and travel posted higher sales so far from a year earlier during the week-long Republic Day sale across ecommerce platforms such as Amazon and Flipkart. These brands expect an added boost this time with quick commerce apps also running sale events.

articles.title: ED chargesheets Winzo, alleges bots duped players of Rs 734 crore
articles.summary: The Enforcement Directorate has charged online gaming firm WinZO and its promoters, accusing it of rigging real-money games using bots and AI. Investigators say users lost Rs 734 crore after being misled into unfair play. The agency also alleged that proceeds of crime generated by the company were laundered through shell companies created in the US and Singapore.

articles.title: ETtech Explainer: Eternal’s older bets hover near breakeven as newer ventures burn cash
articles.summary: Eternal’s December-quarter results show uneven performance across businesses. Blinkit and Hyperpure improved, helped by inventory ownership, margin accretion and early Ebitda profits, even as revenue patterns shifted sharply. Newer businesses such as District and Bistro are still making losses, which hurts overall profitability, even though Zomato’s food delivery business is generating strong cash flows.

articles.title: Elon Musk vs Ryanair CEO: All you need to know about the tech world’s unlikely feud
articles.summary: A dispute over the cost and aerodynamics of Starlink’s in-flight Wi-Fi has blown up into a public war of words between Elon Musk and Ryanair chief Michael O’Leary. What began as a technical debate is now a full-blown business and personality clash.

articles.title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang in Shanghai amid China regulatory headwinds
articles.summary: The timing of Huang's trip, to kick off annual ‌celebrations with ‌Nvidia's China employees, is routine. He is expected to attend an Nvidia party in ‌Shanghai on Saturday before travelling to Beijing, Shenzhen and then Taiwan

articles.title: TikTok names veteran Adam Presser as CEO of US JV
articles.summary: TikTok has appointed Presser, who has been with the video-sharing platform for four years, to head its newly formed US arm, set up as an independent entity after a year-long standoff with Washington and backed by investors, including Oracle and Silver Lake, averting a potential ban.

articles.title: After TikTok deal, Chinese companies search for a new global path
articles.summary: The outcome of a fractured TikTok underscores the difficult choice facing Chinese technology companies with global aspirations. In the United States, they must contend with shifting geopolitical fault lines, drawn-out legal battles and mistrust of any company with Chinese roots. Alternatively, they could chart a different international path -- one with potentially less hassle but without access to the world's largest economy.

articles.title: ET Titan Talks | Sanjeev Krishan: Why India must bet on skills, scale, and AI

articles.title: AI spending frenzy could reshape the economy, Bridgewater CIOs say

articles.summary: The ED has alleged that Winzo defrauded genuine users to the tune of Rs 734 crore. This and more in today’s ETtech Top 5.
